title: Elizabeth Hurley, 54, exudes glamour in a fitted LBD and fur coat as she enjoys a night out
text:
She always dresses to impress.

So it came as no surprise to see Elizabeth Hurley looked phenomenal as she enjoyed a night out at swanky members club Annabel's in London on Tuesday.

The actress, 54, proved that less is more as she donned a muted colour scheme for the outing.

Glam: She always dresses to impress. So it came as no surprise to see Elizabeth Hurley looked phenomenal as she enjoyed a night out at members club Annabel's in London on Tuesday

Showcasing her sensational figure, the mother-of-one slipped into a fitted black crochet dress that offered a look at her tanned and toned pins.

Layering up, Elizabeth shrugged on an oversized black fur coat, whilst she toted a snake print clutch bag.

The Royals star completed the look with a pair of towering black heels, whilst she styled her glossy chestnut locks in loose waves that framed her pretty features.

Glamorous: Showcasing her sensational figure, the mother-of-one slipped into a fitted black crochet dress that offered a look at her tanned and toned pins

As well as being a busy actress and swimwear designer, Elizabeth is also a campaigner for breast cancer awareness.

During her This Morning appearance, Model Liz bravely told hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield: 'I’ve been working to raise awareness for breast cancer for 25 years.

Appearing on This Morning earlier this month, she explained that she lost her grandmother to the disease, reasoning: 'At that time, nobody spoke about breast cancer.'

The Austin Powers star previously revealed her relative showed her scars from a double mastectomy once she finally told her family about her diagnosis, but would often change the subject.

Reflecting on when breast cancer was a taboo subject, the Royals actress explained: 'When I started working for the breast cancer campaign, my grandmother had just died.

'When I was told it was started because women were dying, it really rang home for me, because she didn’t talk about it. There was no awareness, no pink ribbon campaign.'

During her work as a global ambassador for the Estee Lauder Companies' Breast Cancer Awareness Campaign, Liz has insisted she's witnessed 'great changes' in research and attitudes towards the disease.
